topics.body: "My name is not important. What is important is what I'm going to do ... I just fuckin' hate this world. And the human worms feasting on its carcass. My whole life is just cold, bitter hatred. And I always wanted to die violently. This is the time of vengeance and no life is worth saving. And I will put in the grave as many as I can. It's time for me to kill. And it's time for me to die. My genocide crusade begins here."

topics.body:
"@Twisty":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/545ee48e636872218cf80100#post_545ee48e636872218cf80100
Actually, people sees Hatred like a modern version of the first Postal game. You remember Postal 1? The game where you kill everyone for no reason after going postal? If you remember it, you will note that Hatred have a lot similitudes with Postal 1. 

What is really stupid are those persons who says this game "crossed the line" because you kill innocent people, and later say that they have played games like GTA, Postal, Saw, etc.
topics.author: 5239db6da4c72d22d9000358

topics.body:
"@Shadow the Hedgehog":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/545eee0e6368724db2be0100#post_545eee0e6368724db2be0100

Bare in mind. Why do people don't care about killing people in games like GTA? Simple. Death in those games is worth nothing. You kill NPC's till your heart content, but they simply respawn and they are nothing except pixels. No personality, no nothing.

Here on the other hand, every person reacts like a real person and they supposedly stay death and some of the scenarios are something people live every day and it really hits them home.

Not saying that some opinions are exaggerated (That would be an effin' lie).
topics.author: 4fdfbf92945b7075d50036e4

im watching face off and.

i cant believe it took me an hour to notice.

nic cage is named castor

and his brother pollux

JUST LIKE THE GREEK MYTH
topics.author: 5154c5237f123bcd580002fc

topics.body:
"@Shadow the Hedgehog":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/545eee0e6368724db2be0100#post_545eee0e6368724db2be0100
Postal 1 like Hatred seems to utterly lack a sense of humor, which puts it in a very different camp than Postal 2, GTA, ect. Even in more serious games where you can go on a killing spree (GTA IV and V come to mind) it is more contextualized as drama, the killing sprees aren't the whole point of the game.

Personally I look at Hatred and just roll my eyes. It looks fucking dumb as a brick, the sort of stupid angsty edgelord bullshit that 16 year old me would have drooled over.
